intro: Serruria viridifolia, commonly known as the green-leaved serruria, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are typically a vibrant green. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in terminal inflorescences. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens, though it requires careful management to prevent it from becoming invasive.
